intro: Teloxys schraderiana, commonly known as the Schrader's teloxys, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. It thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
